title: Yahoo Email
content: since the recent download of Mozzilla update I cannot get into my Yahool Email account. I was having problem last December since Yahoo required as a verification a cell phone number, not having a cell phone I was allowed to use an alternate email (Hotmail) today I cannot get in because after entering the username and password it once more asks for cell phone. Last month I had an issue trying to log into our Capitol 1 account only to find the once again update from Mozzilla was interfering with access to that account (had to place a call to Capitol 1 tech that informed me why I could not access account). Apparently Mozzilla fixed the problem as it has gone away. Last night after logging off from Yahoo and today while trying to log in with 3 hours spent chasing my tail numerous resets of password and clearing the cache and cookies I am still unable to get into my email at Yahoo is this a problem that you are aware of?
creator: vito2455

title: V. 110.0.1 Hangs C Drive At 100%
content: V. 110.0.1 will consume the C drive to 100% and it will stay there even when FF is not executing. The 13 processes use 750 MB of memory and once the drive is tied up, nothing else can be loaded or run. Sometimes if FF is closed, usage will eventually fall to the point where other processes can run or mouse clicks will be recognized. Sometimes if CCleaner is run after FF is closed, FF will crash even though Task Manager shows no FF processes in the list. This all seemed to start with the installation of v. 110.0.1. I have reinstalled v. 110.0.1 with no effect on the hang issue. The system has been running without FF and no drive hang or 100% usage has been experienced. Will not run FF until a new version is released. Chrome running the same websites does not hang the drive and uses WAAAAAYYYY less RAM. Sad, been using FF for decades. Problem does not exist on my old iPad either. Browser crash data has been sent at least twice.

title: Send button bug in some browsers in online Microsoft Teams (3/8/2023 version) Chat
content:
When chatting in Online Microsoft Teams from the current Google or Firefox browsers, the "paper-airplane-icon" send button does nothing (only when trying to send a chat) at our Educational institution. Several people have tested this at two campuses.

Workarounds include (1) Access online Teams from Edge; (2) Use the Enter key to send the Chat message; or (3) use the Teams Desktop App.

The fact that the send icon doesn't work from current versions of both Firefox and Chrome make me suspect that Teams is not using Valid HTML/Javascript in the handling of this button.

Firefox 1101.0.1 didn't work. Chrome version 111.0.5563.65 (Official Build) (64-bit) doesn't work for any user. Chrome version 110.0.5481.178 (Official Build) (64-bit) didn't work for four users, but worked for one. Chrome version 104.0.5112.102 (Official Build) (64-bit) worked. (Couldn't find intermediate versions online).

Edge Version 110.0.1587.63 (Official build) (64-bit) works. Desktop Teams (365 for Business) Version 1.6.00.1381 (64-bit) works.

The Send button works in Online posting to a Teams Channel, just not in Teams Chat. I have posted this as a problem to both MS Teams and Chrome as well as here.
creator: glindauer

title: Certificado FNMT con protección alta no pide contraseña
content: Hasta hace unos días tenía mi certificado de la FNMT en el almacén de sistemas y configurado con protección nivel alto para que me pida la clave cada vez que lo use (estoy en entorno laboral y por seguridad lo necesito) He renovado mi certificado y ahora aunque lo importé con seguridad alta, en Firefox no me pide la contraseña, lo cual me parece un serio problema (no quiero utilizar la contraseña maestra de Firefox). De hecho en ese mismo navegador tengo instalados otros certificados que aún no han caducado y sigue pidiéndome la contraseña de acceso Quisiera que revisaran este comportamiento y ver cómo solucionarlo. Saludos
creator: amelia.martin

title: [Suggestion] Firefox should respect "xpinstall.signatures.required" again
content:
Firefox should again respect the user's wish expressed by "xpinstall.signatures.required".

The arguments for this are relatively clear and in line with the principles of free and user empowering software original practiced by Mozilla and Firefox.

Users should not be prevented from making their own decisions and customizing the browser or, worse, given an incentive to switch to Chrome due to encroaching opaque motives.

title: How to delete desktop notifications from a provider I've used but never signed up for.
content:
I'd sent my sister an e-card from 123 Greetings on March 2nd. I kept getting notifications in one of my email addresses. I opted out of it, but I've still been getting the desktop notifications. Even though I've contacted them about it several times, they're not much help. They left an address which took me to this area in Firefox & their instructions are very vague & don't make any sense. This is what I received to copy & paste, which is how I got here... about:preferences#privacy Then this... After the options open, scroll down a little and you will find the option notifications, beside that you will find settings option, click on the same, to find all the website you have allowed for receiving notifications from, choose the options accordingly.

There isn't a place to reverse this. Other than asking for help here, I know nothing else to do except to contact my State Attorney General. Thank you in advance for any potential help you can give me.

God bless!

title: Autofill userid fails: always requires emailed verification code
content: I have https://account.firefox.com in my password manager with the appropriate username (my email address) and password. At attempted login I find I must always type (or paste) my username. Autofill by my password manager is not accepted as on all other websites. Upon having so entered the userid, the password manager may then autofill the password as if this were a first-time visit to the website. Further, the login process demands verification via code sent to my email address. This happens over and over. It occurs no matter which browser I use: Firefox or Safari. This is entirely inefficient and encourages me NOT to bother with the website whatsoever!
